title: Honoring Catherine Arline upon the occasion of her designation for special recognition after a lifetime of many achievements
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Catherine Arline upon the occasion of
her designation  for  special  recognition  after  a  lifetime  of  many
achievements

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Catherine Arline has given not only of her time and  energies
but also of her competence, intelligence and leadership and consequently
has been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body  is  justly proud to honor Catherine
Arline upon the occasion of  her  designation  for  special  recognition
after a lifetime of many achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  A native of Ahoskie, North Carolina, Catherine Arline gradu-
ated from Hertford County Public  Schools;  she  became  active  in  her
church,  school  and community at an early age and after graduating from
high school, she attended St. Augustine's College and graduated  with  a
teaching  certificate  in Sociology and Social Studies; it was after her
graduation from St. Augustine's College that she moved to Brooklyn,  New
York; and
  WHEREAS,  In 1960, Catherine Arline began her career with the New York
City Human Resources Administration; in 1967, she received her  Master's
of  Social  Work degree from Howard University School of Social Work and
returned to the Human Resources Administration; and
  WHEREAS, Her passion for helping people led her to a 35 year career in
social work with exemplary service; she retired from the Human Resources
Administration in 1995; at the same time, she was employed as a consult-
ant for the New York State Office of Mental Health, Mental  Retardation,
Disability and Substance Abuse; and
  WHEREAS,  Catherine Arline has been called upon to contribute her time
and talents to countless civic and charitable endeavors and  has  always
given of herself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS,  Catherine  Arline is a paragon in her neighborhood where she
has lived since 1959; she's especially proud of  encouraging  youth  and
negotiating needed services for the elderly; and
  WHEREAS, She is very active in the community and active in the follow-
ing: Kingsboro Addiction Treatment Center Advisory Board, New York State
Board of Directors for Community Options, President of her Block Associ-
ation,  Founding  Board Member and current member of the Board of Direc-
tors Neighborhood Housing Services of Bedford-Stuyvesant, Inc.  (NHSBS),
Active  member  of  Brown Memorial Baptist Church (BMBC), Life member of
Delta Sigma Theta Sorority and member of  Howard  University  School  of
Social  Work  National  Alumni  Association,  St.    Augustine's College
National Alumni Association and the NAACP; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout the entire period  of  her  community  service,  a
period  of constructive involvement, Catherine Arline has stood constant
in dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual for the benefit of  others  which  Catherine  Arline  has  displayed
throughout her life; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense  of  this Legislative Body that those who
enhance the well-being and vitality of their community and have shown  a
long  and  sustained  commitment to excellence certainly have earned the
recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it

  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Catherine Arline upon the occasion of her designation for special
recognition after a lifetime of many achievements; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Catherine Arline.
